page.title: 14Cabbage Growing
page.content: Charleston Farm is the only farm round about here that grows cabbages. They put three seeds in a clump so they know that one will grow. As they grow bigger they take the spare plants out. When they are ready they cut them. Then they are drenched in special chemicals. Then they are put into big boxes and taken to the cold store and a fork lift truck has to take them there because men couldn't carry the heavy boxes. The cabbages they grow are called Dutch White and they store them for 8 months and they sell them to supermarkets for vegetables and coleslaw. They can store 2000 tons of cabbages on the farm.
